news.title: ‘It was hell on earth, it was unrelenting. He just didn’t stop, and he got more brazen as time went on’ – sisters raped by their brother, priest Richard Brennan, tell their story
news.summary: As young children, being awoken in the middle of the night to be abused by their brother Richard Brennan became part and parcel of three sisters’ early life growing up in south Dublin.

news.title: Nearly 1,000 speed camera fines cancelled on one stretch of road over ‘human error’
news.summary: Nearly 1,000 fixed charge notices for speeding offences on a Co Kilkenny road will be revoked, gardaí have said, as a result of “human error”.

news.title: Former All-Star Niall Gilligan told gardaí he acted in a ‘reasonable manner’ to protect himself during alleged assault on boy (12)
news.summary: Former All-Star and Clare All-Ireland winning hurler, Niall Gilligan told Gardai that he acted in a reasonable manner to protect himself from injury and assault from others at the Jamaica Inn hostel on October 5th 2023.

news.title: Woman who tripped over vacuum cleaner in Supermac’s has personal injuries claim dismissed
news.summary: A woman had her personal injuries claim against fast-food restaurant Supermac’s dismissed after a judge found she was “wholly distracted” by her phone when she claimed she tripped over a vacuum cleaner.

news.title: Team Ineos release statement in response to Paul Kimmage article in Sunday Independent
news.summary: Team Ineos have issued a 75-word statement in response to last week’s  Sunday Independent story  revealing links between one of the team’s senior carers and a doctor who was sent to prison for his role in a doping ring.

news.title: Trump denies ‘bawdy letter’ to Epstein and threatens to sue Wall Street Journal as storm grows
news.summary: President Donald Trump announced plans to sue the Wall Street Journal after the paper published a bombshell report detailing an alleged bawdy birthday card Trump gave to Jeffrey Epstein.

news.title: Tabitha Monahan: School places, tariffs, housing – five pieces of unfinished business as TDs go on holidays from Dáil
news.summary: Housing, cost of living, the Budget. Take your pick, there are still plenty of items on the agenda as the Dáil goes on its summer holidays. Not least the threat of a 30pc tariff from the US hanging in the background.

news.title: Declan Lynch: ‘Wimbledon produced two champions who served doping bans, but there wasn’t a word about it’
news.summary: The winners of the men’s and women’s titles at Wimbledon last weekend have served recent suspensions for doping offences – very short suspensions, to be fair, but some would see another scandal in that.

news.title: Woman struck by vehicle in Dalkey car park over the weekend dies
news.summary: A woman, aged in her 70s, who was struck by a vehicle in Dalkey on Sunday has died.

news.title: Ireland’s white spaces: Skip crowded hotspots for Carlow, the Beara and these other Irish ‘dupe destinations’
news.summary: I   arrived into Bagenalstown, Co Carlow, for the first time in my life on a typically cool summer’s day. But the weather began to lift, and the sun started to emerge, as I pulled up along the quayside of a leafy canal.
